summary: The future of civilization rests in the fate of the One Ring, which has been lost for centuries. Powerful forces are unrelenting in their search for it. But fate has placed it in the hands of a young Hobbit named Frodo Baggins (Elijah Wood), who inherits the Ring and steps into legend. A daunting task lies ahead for Frodo when he becomes the Ringbearer - to destroy the One Ring in the fires of Mount Doom where it was forged.

reviews.content: Undeniable masterpiece
The definition of masterpiece.
Simplemente una de las mejores pelis de la historia.
A perfect film trilogy worth watching for Sam alone. Amazing.

While this is not perfectly accurate, its still really good, and is and always will be the best LotR adaptation.  Anyone who decides to make a new adaptation of Tolkien needs to rot in Hell for all eternity.
For any lover of Fantasy this is a must. I would also argue this is the easiest way to engage with Tolkiens work
This movie is legendary and never get bored. A very classic good movie to watch.
Great! Epic battles and Awesome characters! Tolkien would be proud.
The GOAT of all epic trilogies.
Α true masterpiece. The best trilogy in the history of cinema
The beginning of the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy is truly a masterpiece and successfully transports us to Middle-Earth.
Lord of the Rings Fellowship of the Rings is the first part of Peter Jackson's brilliant trilogy. The direction, cinematography, music, and cast are all top notch.
hats off to Jackson and the team
There is no better movie. Period. This is the movie that ends all movies because it has it all and is a cinematic masterpiece that stands the test of time. I watch it multiple times a year.
ABSOLUTE MASTERPIECE

Fellowship of the Ring is a fantastic adaptation to a well loved story. It shows the strength and bonds of brothers in arms as they travel across their world on a mission to save the lives residing there. 

Even decades later this movie still holds up, showing that great story telling never ages.
Amazing film, also watch this if it is on.
The first entry to one of the greatest trilogies of all-time. Is there anything else to say?
Filme extraordinário! Nessa época Hollywood sabia fazer bons filmes sem militância progressista.
Just rewatched for th millionth time and since I'm new to rotten tomatoes had rate.

Una película alucinante, un hito para su época.ñ, una aventura que te traslada a la tierra media, y que si bien puede no tener muchos detalles del libre, cumple con mostrarte la magia y profundidad del mundo de JRR Tolkien. Sin duda de las películas que verás más de una vez en tu vida
A movie brings you to a new world (just like in a classic Apple game called Ultima)
What to say?  I have no complaints about this movie, the characters, the music, the visuals and the rewatch value is top notched.
Boring and too long , hobbit series were better
Good film, good cast and some amazing special effects and the general scale of the film was huge.

Truly one of THE BEST stories ever told, if not THE BEST! Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING about this movie is INCREDIBLE!  Such beautiful scenery and sets, an incredible score by Howard Shore, excellent acting and effects! I COULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS MORE! DOUBLE THUMBS UP! 20/10 STARS!

I am not going to review each of the films this review encompasses them all. I love these films. This fantasy adventure story takes what's possible in film to a whole new level. Every part meticulously thought out and executed with perfection. I prefer the extended editions and enjoy a nice long sit down watching the hobbits navigate Middle-earth.
an incredible and epic odyssey
They copied the cartoon that was done in 1978 so no prize when it comes to story line. Beautiful cinematography and performance.
Hands down, my favorite in the trilogy. I think I prefer when the Fellowship is together.

This trilogy is timeless. Fellowship is my 2nd favorite film in it. The adventure begins here, and it's hard to deny how exciting the prologue at the very beginning is. The only downside to this one is that it feels like it was put out one year too early, as the CGI here looks dated, while in the other films it's barely noticeable. Still fabulous every time. 9.5/10
legolas is the goat!!

This is my favorite LOTR movie. The pacing is really well done so it doesn't feel like it is 3 hours long. While it does deviate from the books in many ways, all of the deviations make sense when translating the books into movies. The journey through Moria is my favorite part of the film, the movie does an excellent job of portraying Moria as this dark and foreboding place. The special effects are still pretty solid. The extended edition is better than the theatrical version.

This should be how all other trilogies should aspire to start the ball rolling. The pacing is so flawless that you won't even notice the 3 hour time stamp. From the opening narration to the heartwarming music and performances, this is a perfect start to what would become the greatest trilogy ever made.
Ótima adaptação e prepara muito bem a continuação da História.

My god this movie is so aewsome. The sheer amount of work and attention to detail that went into creating this movie is mind-boggling. It's a near perfect fantasy movie that always gets me in the mood to go on an adventure. Peter Jackson did a great job putting such a great and exciting movie out of the wonderful, but quite exhausting book. I love basically everything about it, 9.8/10

This movie will go down in history and one of the greatest stories/movies of all time. Tolkien is a genius and Jackson respected his story. This should be on the list of movies you watch before you die.
An absolute master piece. One of the best trilogies of all time.
All expectation met. A great start for a superb trilogy

Reading the books and comparing them to this movie is just perfect. Minor liberties are taken by the writers, but it doesn't stray off from Tolkien's world, and it leaves me with a great desire to finish the series. From the perfect depiction of the peaceful Shire, to the beautiful New Zealand landscape, great acting, character development and plot, and wonderful experience. this movie is a 5/5 for me.

This one is almost perfect, there is hardly anything that I would change. All deviations from books are more or less justifiable, maybe except Arwen. Elvish women should just sit there and smell nice, not ride horses and fight.

Tip: watch the EXTENDED EDITION. It's much better than the standard one.
One of the greatest fantasy films I've seen! Great sets, characters and action. An achievement to be marveled.

The first movie of the trilogy was so good, for an amount of people was perfect.
I liked it so much. Had very good characters,and beautiful ambientations. The story was so interesting.
In my point of view, I think all the people must see the trilogy and "The Hobbit" too, but "The Hobbit" isn't as good as "Lord Of The Ring's" trilogy.
Probably the best of the trilogy, is like an iconic film that everyone knows which is it.
This films have a very good reputation and the effects was amazing for the moment. Most of the people said that the books are already better than films. I didn't read it but I loved the film when I was a child. Hope the books will be magicals.
Awesome movie and in my opinion better than the hobbit movies.
A great setup of this fantastic world with great characters and great action

Favorite movie of all time. The score is beautiful and complex. The giant landscape shots are unmatched and the story is timeless. It's long but worth spending a weekend afternoon watching if you haven't before.
Una obra de arte. Es el tipo de cine que realmente vale la pena ver.
absolutely iconic, endlessly rewatchable
The ultimate and definitive epic!
Amazing. The hobbits are lovable, and it is the best adventure. Shows that no one is too small to make a difference.
Um verdadeiro marco para sua época.

This trilogy is truly a cinematic masterpiece, and is one I've revisited so often it is more akin to an old friend. In fact I'm sure I could repeat much of these trilogies right from memory. The dedication of Jackson's cast is not only obvious in the movie itself, but behind the scenes interviews further delve into the actresses and actors' epic journey to recreate Tolkien's world meticulously in the New Zealand wilderness. The ethereal and sweeping, unfolding world of middle earth brought to life by Jackson never ceases to draw me in, as well as the Howard Shore's captivating soundtrack. 5 stars is not enough to rate this unageing classic.

Jackson succeeds in translating an influential and imaginative, if dense and dry, novel into something palatable allowing time for a broader audience to understand the environment and characters. he is helped by some excellent technical work – not least in production and sound design, location filming and the evocative music score. The actors deliver authentic performances, with McKellen and Lee standouts as opposing wizards, and there are occasional injections of humour to compensate for the darker material. The spectacular set pieces occasionally feel manufactured, and the CGI is variable. But given the project's scope, Jackson achieved a great deal in pulling off a film that pushed the boundaries of cinema expertise.
The first instalment to the greatest trilogy of all time. The music, cast and directing of this and the following movies in the trilogy are absolute perfection.
In my opinion, this movie is peak fantasy. Although the other two are more mature and nuanced (which is impressive), this movie always had a spark to it which I adored.

This is simply the best fantasy trilogy of all time. So much care and passion went into this. Fantastic. Yes, it´s a bit different than the books but it never - ever - changes what the story is about and what Tolkien intened it to be. You have a fantastic script, spot on actors who give everything they have, great visuals, props and camera-work, superp directing and one of the best scores ever written. 
I highly recommend the extended cut because it is even better than the theatrical cut.
Awesome way to start the trilogy!!!!! A+

Saw this movie again recently, after more than 20 years. I saw the extended cut. How marvelous this movie was, a great retelling of a visionary writer. The acting is superb, the direction is perfect. The score is every bit as stirring and dramatic as I remember. Yes, the extended cuts are long, but well worth the time!
This movie will always be a classic
Absolutely loved it.

I grew up with Tolkien from reading him in grade school. I am an old man now. Throughout the years, I have seen all the cartoons, listened to the books on tape, played with the lead figures in the 1970s as an early teen, etc. Back in early and mid 1970's, there wasn't a ton of LOR imagery and art. It was mostly in your head. This was before the Dungeons and Dragons explosion. Peter Jackson did an excellent version of these books. The characters look just like you imagined as a child reading the books. The introduction of the female elf character, in my opinion, even enhanced the stories and was well acted. I wished Jackson had carried all this quality into The Hobbit series that he made a little too much like a fantasy video game that was all over the place in parts. But that said, these 3 LOR movies are excellent and anyone would be hard pressed to out do them for many, many years to come.
The best movie of the best trilogy ever!!

Writing : 10/10
Acting : 9/10
Cinematography : 9/10
Costume design : 10/10
CGI effects : 10/10
Set design : 10/10
Artistic vision 10/10
Adaptation ranking : 9/10
Best movie I have ever seen, and best of a fantastic trilogy. Will forever be a classic.
The greatest movie of the perfect trilogy. To this day I'm still in awe.

This is easily my favorite movie of all time from beginning to end. Not just because I prefer adventure over a big battle story but also thanks to the performance the setting, the music, the visuals and the overall atmosphere. I would say that this movie is the closest you could get to perfection.
thats perfect,is the best movie of all time

Exceptional. Not a perfect adaptation, but probably the best anyone could make from the Professor's vision. The first film in a trilogy that is most likely the greatest in cinema history. What more is there to be said?
The start of the best trilogy in movies history.

The acting, music, dialogs, CGI, costumes everything was breathtaking!!!
I can't even describe what I feel for this trilogy - A MUST TO WATCH
Great story, amazing cast and great acting

The seemingly never ending journey by Frodo and friends all started with this epic from Peter Jackson. This is a fantastically made film although it's so god damn long.  Couldn't they have gotten guys with longer legs to do this mission?  May have only taken two movies.   Anyway the special effects are excellent and the story, from J.R.R. Tolkien is a classic.  Hard to believe this was made twenty one years ago.
ring movie numero #1. this movie is good but its just rly long - Light 8/10
Best in the trilogy.
This movie is amazing!!   I am a lifelong fan of Tolkien and this is a 90%+ Wow!!

The best movie ever made! With the best movie acting ever by an ensemble! Plus the best casting ever done in a movie! Also, the best directing from Peter Jackson! In addition, the best movie screenplay ever adapted! As well as the best movie score ever composed! Not to mention the best production design ever made in a movie! Not only that, but the best makeup and hairstyling ever done in a movie, the best sound mixing ever done in a movie, the best sound editing ever done in a movie, and the best visual effects ever done in a movie!

I really wany to see the critics who downvoted this movie. How stupid can you feel when you realise you just reviewed poorly one of the greatest movie of all time. And you call yourselves movie critics.
I've never read the books, but this movie is excellent (the entire Jackson trilogy is excellent). A great start to your LOTR adventure

It is without a doubt that Peter Jackson's "Lord of the Rings" trilogy is one of the greatest series of films ever to grace our screens. This first film immediately draws the viewer into the depths of it's world with it's opening scene, and from there the whole film is an adventure. Tolkien's world is vast, and while there is no way in this world even a trilogy of films could contain its magnitude, this film does so to the highest extent of possibility. And it wonderfully sets up what is to come...
third best movie ever made

This movie is close to perfection. Second only to the sequels. Many prefer this movie because of the more personal story but I find it to be slightly less re-watchable than The Two Towers or Return of the King.
Amazing movie! The actors are great and the CGI is good.

One of the greatest movies of all time. I remember seeing it in theaters, and being on the edge of my seat for the entire 3 hours.

My main memory is actually being upset that it was ending. As well as being upset that I'd have to wait, for what seemed like an eternity, for the next movie to come out.

Peter Jackson is a genius (and of course Tolkien is as well for creating the source material). 

People seem to forget how hard it is to condense these books into only 3 movies. In fact, the only reason someone should ever even think of attempting to remake them is so they can do 2 movies per book instead of 1. However, I wouldn't want the job of being compared to this masterpiece.

A master piece. After watching the new series "The rings of Power" I realized how well done the original trilogy was and how awful they made this new attempt. Forever grateful with Peter Jackson for making this.
This is a legendary intro to the Lord of the Rings Trilogy and starts the series off on a super high note. An absolute must see thriller!
Perfeição, tenho o habito de todo ano revisar esta trilogia nas suas versões estendidas e sempre admirar o quã este filmes são epicos e perfeitos.
Great cast. Great adaptation. Great CGI. Faithful adaptation, except for the timeline, but that is to be expected.

Classic and beautiful.

Ah, Middle-Earth - what an unforgettable magical movie, an all-time classic. From the narration by Galadriel (the sublime Cate Blanchett) to the last moment when Frodo and Sam stare over desolate wasteland towards Mount Doom, this is a journey like no other. Thank you, Peter Jackson and JRR Tolkien.

The first is a masterpiece in a trilogy of movies that looks almost like gods created it. This movie is awesome and Peter Jackson's respect for Tolkien's work and how dedicated they were to make this movie great is incomparable. The series only gets better from this incredible film. In addition, you can't have a good film without a Sean Bean death. I'd like to see Amazon do this. If they were even half as good as this for their premier, the people would love the first two episodes or better yet the show.

Simply the first few minutes wow me. A less accomplished filmmaker than Peter Jackson would have jumped right into the Party and left the audience hopelessly disoriented because Lord of the Rings is a highly intricate film. Peter Jackson, however, refrained from doing so. He created a fantastic prologue with Cate Blanchett's mesmerising voice that truly provides all the information required. The instant she said, "The world has altered," I thought, I anticipated it would be a treat.

Legendary, i cant explain with words how much i love this movie. Everything about it, its dynamic, its story, the feelings you get while watching it. Really really good
Can't believe this movie came out 21 years ago, and I can still watch it over and over!

This movie is an instant classic, this year marks its 20th anniversary of this movie. So, I thought it'd be the perfect time to write a review for it! When it comes to fans of the Middle-Earth series (both movies and books) there is one thing most of us can agree on, that being that Peter Jackson basically did just as much for J.R.R. Tolkien's stories as J.R.R. Tolkien himself. This movie has aged amazingly well in my opinion, the VFX & SFX both hold up today. FOTR is the perfect first act to a three-part story while telling a fantastic and well-fleshed-out story itself, it has the perfect mix of whimsical and dark fantasy. It handles nine lead characters beautifully without taking from the primary story at hand, it gives each of its leads a moment to shine and gives most of them complete individual story arcs. If you're a fan of the books who's never seen the movies, a fantasy movie fanatic who's never seen the movies, or even someone who's read the books and seen the movies it's worth watching (for the first time or a rewatch). This movie trilogy is one of those rare occasions where something that should've been impossible became a colossal success, this poster boy of the heroes' journey shows what can happen when you are passionate enough about something.

The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring brings J.R.R. Tolkien's classic fantasy novel on the big screen, and the result is a marvelous picture with memorable characters, great cast, awesome plot and epic action.
The story is a bit different from the books, but that's understandable, really well done though.
My favourite movie! I watched it over 20 times and I never got bored.
Maravillosa adaptacion del libro, no es 100% igual pero si lo fuera serian 8 horas por pelicula, pero se nota el respeto y amor por Tolkien............
For being a 2001 movie, the special effects were awesome and the choice of actors was very good as well.
I've had to watch this again to rinse the Rings of Power out of my mouth.
Um dos melhores filmes da história!
impresionante! excelente, fiel y honorable adaptación de la historia de Tolkien.

The best trilogy of movies ever made.
1st title is intimate at first but it shows epic throughout all the rest

Nothing short than a masterpiece of cinema.
an epic trilogy, love it so much

A great start to the trilogy. 
Tolkien would be proud

No faults, aside from the shots where you can tell gimli's stunt double is in the scene rather than the actual actor. This goes for all the films

A once in a lifetime movie trilogy.

The story is coherent and extremely camptivating and immersive. The spirit of Tolkein's world unmatched.

The acting is a 10/10.

The dialogue impressive and meaningful.

The action scenes are impressive, without being over the topic, and even when they are a bit cheesy (very rarely) it's cheesy in a good way.

And while the movie(s) do not respect Tolkein's writings 100% they stay faithful to the spirit of Tolkein.

I'm in my mid twenties and I'd be surprised if I ever see such a great movie be made again in my lifetime.

Peter Jackson has done Tolkien's work real justice! Back then, it was a worry how the epic would turn out (perhaps fears it would end up being like that awful Dungeons and Dragons film a few years before), but thankfully it is a game changing masterpiece that has captured the tone and feel of Middle Earth convincingly. The opening prologue is guaranteed to give you goosebumps. It is clear to see that the sets, costumes and designs have been well thought through and so much effort has been made to ensure that this film is one of the best cinematic experiences anyone would witness. The actors are well chosen, the performances are brilliant and the effects are impressive. The scene with the Balrog is tense and exciting. Definitely the greatest fantasy film ever made!
One of the cinematic masterpieces of all time. Great cast, great directing and great special effects. This is how a movie should be made.
Best movie trilogy of all time.
J'ai du le voir 40 ou 60 fois..... voila....
Best movie of all times.

10/10.
Really good. Perfecto. Perfeição.

One of the best movies I've ever seen. This trilogy will not let you down. STRONGLY recommend watching.
Excellent!  Non Woke!

Peter Jackson did an amazing job. Super cast. Did Tolkien proud

Hard to believe this magnificent film is 21 years old. It's as good today as it was back then when it introduced a new generation to the magic of middle-earth. Visually stunning, briliantly written and directed, excellent acting, and a hauntingly beautiful soundtrack. Movie making doesn't get any better than this.
Tolkien at his best envisioned by a master of the craft. Where have you been hiding if you have not seen this? One of the best films of our generation.
film came to revolutionize the history of cinema with a great director and great professionals behind the work that was very close to lore.

Excellent adaptation of the book.  There were items left out of course, but the overall themes were present, no pushed messages.  This was simply a tale retold through the eyes of a fan with a large budget who knew what they were doing.  I now wish to visit New Zeland

The first installment of the greatest trilogy in film history. Peter Jackson's adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy masterpiece captures the atmosphere, magic and adventure of the original story, bringing every character to life. I loved it when it was released decades ago, and I still love it just as much today.
a work of art and faithful portrayal of tolkien's wonder
One of the most amazing childhood movies, masterpiece !
Best movie of all time.. everything about it is perfect from character, visually spectacular, sounds amazing.. I could go on but words can't describe

I had the privilege of seeing FOTR in the cinema in 2001. Breathtaking movie making from a master of his craft. It was immediately clear the talent of everyone involved. Tolkien's Middle Earth brought to life. I have no idea how many times I've watched this film. It never gets old. It still has the power to fully emerge me in Tolkien's lore on screen. If I had to choose a favourite of the trilogy, it would be Fellowship. Highly recommended viewing.
I love the Lord of the Rings trilogy.  :-)  Very well done.
Aquele filme 10/10 que todo mundo ama!
Peak of cinema and the fantasy genere specifically. I can't rank this movie against its two sequels, but this must be my favorite movie trilogy of all times!

The opening act to the definitive fantasy series of our age is just terrific. It's long but dense and very entertaining, with just the right mix of action, wit, pathos, and grand spectacle. Director/co-writer Peter Jackson and his production team bring Tolkien's words to vivid life, immersing us in a Middle Earth that feels at once fantastical yet organic and earthy. The location shooting in Jackson's native New Zealand is often stunning. The cast sparkles across the board, from Viggo Mortensen's reluctant hero, to Elijah Wood's curious and brave Hobbit, to Christopher Lee's menacing turn as the evil wizard Saruman. Sean Bean, Orlando Bloom, a blustery John Rhys-Davies, and especially Sean Astin make great fellowship mates. Ian McKellen is just grand as the wise and weary Gandalf. But two of the best moments go to the women in this tale, Liv Tyler and the luminous Cate Blanchett. What sets this apart from other inferior fantasy fare is the gravitas of the story. Death isn't greeted with one-liners, but with fear and grief. Each loss in the journey is deeply felt. The victories--small and large--are thrilling. It's a sweeping epic, one that gets us engrossed and involved, and makes us anticipate the next chapter of this saga
The best big-screen adaptation of Tolkien so far.
Funny thing, we can rate this movie, but for some reason, Rotten Tomatoes has turned off ratings on the new Amazon Spinoff.  Whatever could have caused that?
I think this is my favorite movie of the original trilogy, still amazing to watch today 20 years later
its one of my favorite childhood movies

Masterpiece, captures Tolkiens world perfectly.
Timeless masterpiece, way to start best trilogy there is

A masterpiece. Go back and watch any fantasy film before this. Absolutely genre definitely, ground breaking for it's time. Still holds up today. Character focused and epic. One of the best film scores you ears will be blessed with.
Fantastic movie in every sense, there will be nothing like this anymore, even the extended edition is short!

It's difficult to to judge these movies individually as together they are the greatest film trilogy of all time. This movie had the impossible task of bringing Tolkiens world to life, and knocked it out of the park.
Well paced faithful adaptation.
Masterpiece of film making
Near perfect. By far the best of the trilogy.
This is what everyone is the film industry should aspire for. Truly a masterpiece!
One of the greatest achievements of film history.
the original, the best, the only
This is what a Tolkein based show or adaption to strive to be like...sadly, the ROP is nothing like it.
A beautifully made adaptation of a beloved story.
Perfect pallet cleanser after "The Rings of Power".
Great cinematography, great actors, held true (for the most part) to Tolkiens books.
it is 1/3 part of my soul.
Absolute imaculate masterpiece. Highjacked my heart and dragged my soul to this mythological universe in the first 10 minutes. Eternal love. Always a pleasure to rewatch.

The first film of the greatest film trilogy of all time. Christopher Tolkien may not have liked it due to lore inaccuracies, it is still in a league of its own compared to anything has come before or since in film. Cannot say enough good things about this film.
My favorite movie, I see it every year.
perfection. Truly a masterpiece of cinema.
Second best movie ever made

As close to perfection in film as you are likely to get...  Whilst the film makes changes to the book, some of which certainly weaken the film and do not add to Tolkien's masterpiece, overall the producers realized the importance of respecting and honoring Tolkien.... Whereas the god-awful Rings of Powers did the opposite, Jackson and his crew tried to adhere as closely as possible to the book and the result is a breathtaking film which captures the beauty and heart of Tolkien's great work.

This film could not have existed today, it was able to achieve Tolkien's world technically with clever use of location, art and technology, whilst still being of a time before the grand-standing baggage plaguing the world today.

Truly one of the best films ever in my humble opinion, one that appeals to young and old, fans of fantasy, history and film in general alike.
Epic! The only true visualisation of LOTR

Amazing, Amazing, Amazing, Amazing
The first part is by far the best I have seen in film history and is therefore a masterpiece that is unparalleled!

A perfect cast, stunning locations, incredible practical effects, and a completely original directive style that somehow blends horror/gore, Monty Python like humour, on-stage like drama, and epic action. This film might be the greatest ever adaptation of Tolkien's work as it truly captures beauty, self sacrifice, death, and the call to adventure. It was made at the perfect time by the right people at that time. And I haven't even mentioned perhaps the most important part: Howard Shore's unbelievable score, which is on the Mount Rushmore of film scores. Peter Jackson (along with his writing partners) pulls career performances from Mortensen, McKellen, Blanchett, and Bean. This might be the greatest film of the 20th century, and certainly the greatest trilogy of all time.

This movie is a classic and what kicked off the most epic journey ever. The trilogy is my absolute happy place. I can just put the movie on and get transported to Middle Earth, and forget all my troubles for a couple of hours. No matter how many years go by, this movie (and the trilogy) is timeless and a beauty to behold. Not only because of the outstanding actors and actresses, but also due to the love PJ has put into the movies. It doesn't feel like you're watching a movie. It's like a portal opens up and you can directly peek into Middle Earth yourself.

One of the best book to movie adaptations around. Even with all of the character and story building, there is enough action and excitement to make you forget this is a three hour movie. I also appreciate the blend of CGI and live action as opposed to the over CGI'd Hobbit trilogy.
Greatest movie of all time
Incredible acting, storytelling, cinematography, and character development! If you haven't seen the LOTR trilogy, drop what you're doing and watch it right now!
Terrible. Runtime too long, mid as hell. Paddington 2 and Attack on Titan >>>>>
Spellbinding masterpiece. True to tolkiens visions unlike Amazon's garbage show

The movie is amazing. Everything about it is perfect. Introduces us to Frodo, Sam, Gandalf, and Aragorn in a great way and tells a good story for a first installment. It's slower than the other two but it works for this type of movie. One of my favorite movies ever, I love it.
A film for the generations! Highly complimentary to the books, and represents everything the new rubbish rings of power isn't.
This was a masterpiece. Not completely faithful to the books, but enthralling from beginning to end. Might be my favorite of the three.

The film that kicked off the trilogy and led to the Hobbit sequels as well as the upcoming TV series. Peter Jackson's interpretation of the famous Tolkien novel set the stage and did a fantastic job laying the groundwork for the upcoming adventures of the little hobbit, Frodo and his companions. I always enjoyed the other two films slightly more due to the action sequences but don't want to take anything away from the Fellowship. Highly underrated cast - Viggo, Bloom, McKellan and of course, Sean Bean.

The Fellowship of the Ring: Not just a Movie, but the Door to another Dimension
The first part of the Lord of the Rings trilogy, the Fellowship of the Rings opened the door to a whole new world for me. I'd never read any of Tolkien's books when I saw the film for the first time at the theatre and, now that I've read them, in retrospect I think being a neophyte to the mythology made my LOTR movie experience all the more miraculous.

I loved The Two Towers and Return of the King almost as much as FOTR, but not quite, because seeing Fellowship for the first time was like taking a journey to a fabulous new place and meeting incredible new friends that you don't want to leave. I've never felt anything quite like what this epic evoked in me. It was akin to being a child again, with that tireless sense of wonder and enjoyment of each and every moment, maybe because as a child you are discovering your surroundings, and whatever age you are, when you watch the Fellowship of the Ring you are rendered in awe upon being introduced to the purity and beauty of Middle Earth and darkly enthralled by the majesty of Eisengard, Saruman, Sauron and all of their mighty malice. One of the things that makes this movie so special (and there are so many!) is that you fall in love not only with the "good" characters, but also with the "evil" ones. For example, Christopher Lee was amazing as Saruman, and I can't imagine the movie without him.

Some films that might be comparable to the Lord of the Rings trilogy are: The Fifth Element, the Star Wars Trilogy parts IV, V and VI (forget the newer prequels), the Matrix trilogy (especially the first part), Interview with a Vampire, the Legend of Sleepy Hollow (with Johnny Depp), Logan's Run and The Island. They are all excellent movies and works of art that weave that movie magic that keeps you spellbound and entranced for the duration of their runtime.

But after seeing The Fellowship of the Ring, I knew I had found the movie by which I would judge all other movies. Based on J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved books, Peter Jackson has set a new standard in the industry of cinema, one that I honestly think has not and won't be surpassed, at least not in my lifetime, not even by PJ himself.

It is truly an instant classic that will stand the test of time and be loved by generations to come. God Bless Tolkien and Jackson and everyone involved in the conception and making of this film, for creating a world that is at my fingertips, only takes the touch of a button to go to whenever I want, and makes me forget everything else.

The LOTR Trilogy is undoubtedly MY precious, the non plus ultra of all movies!
